examples: What gars this din of mirk and baleful harm, / Where everywean is all betaint with bloud?
The thickness of mirk is bad enough, but the thickness of white, illimitable ether is worse a thousandfold, for it closes the eye and mazes the wits.

verbs.description: mirk (third-person singular simple present mirks, present participle mirking, simple past and past participle mirked)

examples: And there they lay so near his little heart, / With whispering of things that happened not, / Until the serpent green had mirked / His manly vision in a way that lost / The anchorage of balanced sanity.
